body.S: It's natural to try to compare yourself to others, but this is not always helpful. If you're feeling discouraged about your health compared to those around you, just focus on the many positive changes you've already made in your life!
Tracking what you eat every day is a great way to be more aware of your diet. Try keeping a food diary so you can see where you are doing well and where you can make improvements.

Tracking what you eat every day is a great way to be more aware of your diet. If you like using phone apps, try MyFitnessPal or other similar apps that allow you to track your daily calories in an easy and quick way!

Food packaging often has a lot of helpful information. First, look at the serving size; often, one serving is only a portion of the package and not the whole thing. Next, focus on the calories and carbohydrates per serving and note these in your food diary!

It is always helpful to check the nutrition label on snacks and meals. While high amounts of fiber, protein, and vitamins are beneficial, you want to make sure that you are limiting your intake of carbohydrates, fat, and sodium.

Keeping track of your food can feel like a time-consuming chore with your busy schedule. Try keeping a piece of paper or a phone app on hand to make tracking faster after each meal. Alternatively, you can take a picture of your meal before you eat so you can record it later!

Keeping track of your food can feel like a time-consuming chore, especially when you have to make note of your food several times per day. Try setting reminders on your phone or watch; soon, it will just feel like a normal part of your regular routine!

Getting started with a new exercise routine can feel really intimindating! Try starting with short, low-intensity exercises such as taking a walk around the block. Then, work up gradually in intensity as you feel yourself getting stronger!

Setting goals can be really helpful in establishing a new routine. Try setting exercise goals for yourself based on your own personal fitness level. Your goals should be challenging yet realistic so you don't get discouraged!
You don't need fancy machines or weights to build your muscles. Try strength training with body weight exercises like squats, push-ups, or lunges in the comfort of your own home!

Fitting exercise into your busy day can be a challenge! There are often simple changes that you can try that will make a big difference. For example, try waking up just 30 minutes earlier or leaving a few minutes after dinner to fit in a walk.

A simple way to add exercise into your schedule is to walk or bike places instead of driving. If it's possible, try walking or biking to work or when doing errands to increase your daily physical activity!

Most of us spend more time analyzing bad events rather than savoring and appreciating positive events. Focusing on the positive is a skill that takes time and practice. Try to reflect on three positive moments from your day today!

Even during difficult times, it is often possible to recognize positive moments. Recognize and face your challenges today with determination but also try to note and appreciate the small, positive moments along the way!

Take time today to reflect on one positive thing that has happened and think about how it made you feel. If you write it down, you may experience an even bigger boost of joy from the simple act of recording it!
People often remember negative events more easily than positive events. Today, try to balance this out by purposefully focusing more on the good parts of your day rather than the negative parts!

Focusing on bad events can help us learn from them and avoid similar situations in the future. However, don't forget to savor and appreciate the good events as well so you can have more of them in the future!

It is common to spend more time focusing on our shortcomings rather than our strengths. Today, remind yourself of one of your personal strengths and brainstorm a way to use this personal strength in a new way this week!
Having a sense of mastery or expertise over something can feel really good. Today, do something that you are good at to remind yourself of your abilities!
Reflecting on personal strengths can help you realize just how remarkable your abilities are. Today, try using a talent or strength that you haven't thought about in awhile!
Using our unique personal strengths can boost self-esteem, increase energy, reduce stress, and increase feelings of productivity. Use a personal strength today to give youreself a boost of energy!
We often don't give ourselves enough credit for our skills and expertise. Spending more time thinking about your strengths can help you remember to give yourself the credit you deserve!
A personal strength is a quality that feels genuine to who you are as a person. Identify a personal strength and use it today to put yourself back in touch with who you feel you truly are.
Choose and use one of your many personal strengths today! Possibilities include curiosity, love of learning, bravery, persistence, honesty, love, or teamwork.
Choose and use one of your many personal strengths today! Possibilities include fairness, leadership, humility, self-control, appreciation of beauty and excellence, humor, or spirituality.
